intro: Pyrostria andilanensis var. nossibeensis, commonly known as the Nossibe pyrostia, is a rare and endemic plant species found in specific regions of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elongated, narrow leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered vulnerable to extinction.
